Sentencas: The development of multiphase composite electrocatalysts plays a key role in achieving the efficient and durable operation of intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (IT-SOFCs).
Titulo: Effectively Promoting Activity and Stability of a MnCo2O4-Based Cathode by In Situ Constructed Heterointerfaces for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Herein, a self-assembled nanocomposite is developed as the oxygen reduction reaction (ORR) catalyst for IT-SOFCs through a coprecipitation method.
Titulo: Effectively Promoting Activity and Stability of a MnCo2O4-Based Cathode by In Situ Constructed Heterointerfaces for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The nanocomposite is composed of a doped (Mn0.6Mg0.4)(0.8)Sc0.2Co2O4 (MMSCO) spinel oxide (84 wt %), an orthorhombic perovskite phase (11.3 wt %, the spontaneous combination of PrO2 additives and spinel), and a minor Sc2O3 phase (4.7 wt %).
Titulo: Effectively Promoting Activity and Stability of a MnCo2O4-Based Cathode by In Situ Constructed Heterointerfaces for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The surface of the (Mn0.6Mg0.4)(0.8)Sc0.2Co2O4 phase is activated by the self-assembled nanocoating with many heterogeneous interfaces.
Titulo: Effectively Promoting Activity and Stability of a MnCo2O4-Based Cathode by In Situ Constructed Heterointerfaces for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Thence, the ORR kinetics is obviously accelerated and an area-specific resistance (ASR) of similar to 0.11 Omega cm(2) is obtained at 750 degrees
Titulo: Effectively Promoting Activity and Stability of a MnCo2O4-Based Cathode by In Situ Constructed Heterointerfaces for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: C. Moreover, a single cell with the cathode shows a peak power density (PPD) of 1144.1 mW cm(-2) at 750 degrees C, much higher than that of the cell with the MnCo2O4 cathode (456.2 mW cm(-2)).
Titulo: Effectively Promoting Activity and Stability of a MnCo2O4-Based Cathode by In Situ Constructed Heterointerfaces for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: An enhanced stability of similar to 120 h (0.8 A cm(-2), 750 degrees C) is also achieved, related to the reduced thermal expansion coefficient (13.9 x 10(-6) K-1).
Titulo: Effectively Promoting Activity and Stability of a MnCo2O4-Based Cathode by In Situ Constructed Heterointerfaces for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The improvement in ORR kinetics and stability can be attributed to the refinement of grains, the formation of heterointerfaces, and the enhancement of mechanical compatibility.
Titulo: Effectively Promoting Activity and Stability of a MnCo2O4-Based Cathode by In Situ Constructed Heterointerfaces for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
